intro: Galanthus nivalis subsp. cilicicus, commonly known as the Caucasian snowdrop, is a rare and distinctive subspecies of the snowdrop genus. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, including parts of Turkey and Georgia. This subspecies is characterized by its pale white flowers with a distinctive yellow or green tip on the outer petals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland floors or rocky crevices. The plant is valued for its ornamental beauty and is considered a rare and delicate member of the Amaryllidaceae family.
